poem:
Title: "Politics in the Grey Light of Morning"

Partisan reeds grapple in the political sea,
Chertoff voices hover like dust – a high decree.
"Treason, bribery, felonious hours, 
aren't the domain of policy's duelling powers."
Impeachment cries dissolve into day's crest,
Slipping on the grey robes of the disgruntled west,
A nation waits; whispers in the history's ear,
What next, what now, forms our common fear.
